content: that end off 9 scbp in yellow 32 round 6-8 single_crochet around at the end of round 8 do your slip_stitch like normal but switch to brown yarn before chain 1 up to next row 32 round 9 single_crochet around in brown 32 round 10 single_crochet around in yellow 32 round 11 single_crochet around in brown 32 round 12 single_crochet around in yellow 32 this is the last round with any yellow so you can tie off the yellow after this round 13-14 single_crochet around in brown this image shows the second stitch of round 15 in progress currently three back posts of the st3pbtg stitch are looped on the hook just waiting for a yarn over and pull through to finish the st3bptg stitch round 15 scbp st3bptg 5 scbp x 3 st3bptg 4 scbp 24 we are going to stop stitching individual row and switch to stitching in a spiral this makes it possible to decrease in the corners so at the end of this round do not do a single_crochet and a slip_stitch at the first stitch of the round 16 crochet right into the top of the first stitch of the round 15 round 16 invisible st3tog 3 single_crochet x 3 invisible st3tog 1 single_crochet 15 stuff body continued round 17 invisible st3tog 1 single_crochet x 3 invisible st3tog 7 partial round 18 single_crochet invisible st3tog slip_stitch tie off and leave a medium length tail sew the hole closed wings crochet in a spiral make 2 wings round 1 with white yarn 8 single_crochet in magic_ring round 2 single_crochet and half_double_crochet in the first stitch 3 half_double_crochet in the next stitch 1 single_crochet in the next stitch then slip stitch into the next stitch and tie off leaving a long tail for sewing sew in middle of the top of the bee about 6 stitches apart the top side of the bee is the side further from the eyes legs locate the bottom of the bee the black eyes will be closer to the bottom side of the body than the top side of the body the legs will go on the two brown stripes about 6 stitches apart on the bottom side of the bee tie brown yarn to one of the stitches where the legs will go stick your hook under one of the stitches yarn over and pull through now chain 6 tight stitches the last chain leave a large loop and remove your hook from it locate the stitch you want to build the second leg from on the adjacent brown stripe of the bee stick your hook under this stitch and come out underneath your previous leg hook the large loop on your hook see above picture and pull it back through tighten the loop a bit then chain 6 more tight chain picture below is after the first of these chains end the chain and tie off leaving a long tail tie the tail to the base of the leg
